author: kevaundray
content: Checked this and yep I think it should be returning the degree-1 element and not the degree-0 in general

author: jsign
content: thanks <@427491045308235776>  for verifying it. created a pr to fix it https://github.com/crate-crypto/small-powers-of-tau/pull/4. left a note there recommending the other repo if there's any other external reader.

author: jsign
content:
question to double check: is https://ceremony.ethereum.org/#/record working as expected?
I've searched for some ethereum addresses from the transcript (https://kzg-ceremony-sequencer-dev.fly.dev/info/current_state) but they don't seem to appear in the website.
maybe there're two test environments?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<nicoserranop> Hi Ignacio! :) The frontend sequencer we are using right now is: https://sequencer.ceremony.ethereum.org/info/current_state

This is the server that would be used in production and in the next couple of days we would reset the transcript.

The fly.dev server was our initial testnet. We are expecting to have loads of requests so we migrate it to a more powerful machine

author: bridge-bot
content:
<trent_vanepps> > <trent_vanepps>  if you see the fly.dev URL anywhere in documentation, please forward so we can update it! (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <ignacio (jsign)> question to double check: is https://ceremony.ethereum.org/#/record working as expected?
I've searched for some ethereum addresses from the transcript (https://kzg-ceremony-sequencer-dev.fly.dev/info/current_state) but they don't seem to appear in the website.
maybe there're two test environments?)

author: jsign
content:
<@420951281910284289> , yes, I got it from the apiSpec yaml file: https://github.com/ethereum/kzg-ceremony-specs/blob/af0f7f39dc4096c8446dab1f6e7d2d5657663997/apiSpec/sequencerApi.yml#L13
So both URLs listed there should probably be deleted and we should add https://sequencer.ceremony.ethereum.org
If you want I can create a PR to change it (if that's the correct change).

author: jsign
content: Pretty useful that we're using the same URL today for devnet as the future mainnet one... I can remove a `--devnet` flag I added to my client to distinguish envs.
